title: You know how you can tone down damage, CC, and mobility in one fair swoop?
body:
Reduce CDR across the board so summoners rift can stop trying to evolve into URF.

The biggest problem in this game is how easily acquired CDR is. It doesn’t even have to be 40%, though most champions end up achieving it save for ADCs (and even then many of them end up getting around 10-20%). 

Make the game have cooldowns again, and many of the complaints you have would diminish quickly (of course we’d still complain about the sky being blue, oxygen and the fact that hydroxytryptamine is a word, but my point still stands).

If you're running magic penetration into tanks, you're doing the exact opposite of what you should be doing.

Flat pen is horrible against any more than base resistances. Against tanks, you should be stacking AP and CDR, and throwing in a Void and Liandry
I remember seeing somewhere that as long as you have Void Staff, double flat pen is still efficient against anything with less than 200 MR.

No at 200 MR it's reducing it by 80. 
Two 15 pen items are 30. So anything below 75 is worse than having two pen items. 

If we just flat out assume you will be getting boots with +15 than that number changes as Morrellos is the only pen option. Meaning any target under 55 MR is better to not get void. because the break point is 40 MR for 1 items  and Sorc boots give 15. 


SOOOOOO in short. If they have more targets with more than 55 MR as a whole get Void. 

BECAUSE MATH!

(this does not take into consideration cost and GW, Morellos into Mundo is a must.)

Actual numbers 
{{item:3165}}  -15 MR
{{item:3020}}  -15 MR
{{item:3135}}  -16 MR at 40 MR / - 32 at 80  / -40 at 100/ -80 at 200

I’m talking about what happens if you stack Void Staff with flat pen.  Now I imagine it varies by champion based on base damage vs AP ratios, but I was talking about how efficient the flat pen is versus going for higher AP instead once you get Void Staff.  Fully-stacked mpen reduces 200 MR to 87, which is a loss of effective HP equal to 113% of (max HP + shields + any healing).

Gotcha,  well some champions (using all abilities) go well over 100% utilization of AP, but we'll do that just because.... simplicity and to get a base line. 
Morrelos and void offers 70 AP for 140 total. Sorc obviously offers none. 

So we have the 40%/+30

At 140 AP, I think it's obvious having the pen is better at ALL MRs so lets ignore that.

>FYI MR/ARM is calculated by 
Resist/(Resist+100)
So for 100 MR 50/50+100 = 33% 

If the pen items are all a person has then. 

>Resist  -(void) -flat = damage done 

50 MR  -(20) -30 = 140 damage, True damage 
100 MR  -(40)-30 = 107.7 damage
200 MR  -(80)-30  = 73

Lets start low at 200 AP (No pen)
50 MR = 200-33% = 133
100 MR =  200-50% = 100
200 MR = 200-66%  = 67

So at 200 AP you are less effective than a full pen build at all times despite having less AP. 

The break point however is not far.
At 225 AP we are already more effective than a full pen build. 
50 MR = 225-33% = 151
100 MR =  225-50% = 112.5
200 MR = 225-66%  = 76.5

While 225 does instantly surpass a full pen build, the only factors to truly consider are cost/AP ratios. If your AP ratios are lower than 100% combined on a rotation than you must have even more AP than this to break even. (and get that juicy +3.5 damage on a target with 200 MR) 
Cost will bite you though, Sorc immediately make it to where getting three other items is just worse. 

And then getting a Rabs or something AP heavy on the pen build makes the numbers skew heavily to the pen build. 

Lets do that in the 225 AP vs 140 AP +Pen and add Rabs.

140AP+ Rabs = 364 (PEN)
50 MR  -(20) -30 = 364 damage, True damage 
100 MR  -(40)-30 = 280 damage
200 MR  -(80)-30  = 191.57

225AP+ Rabs = 483
50 MR = 483-33% = 323.6
100 MR =  483-50% = 241.5
200 MR = 483-66%  = 164.22


So in general while you may get +11 damage on a 3 item full ap build against pen at 225 AP. It's probably still better to get void since afterwards the Pen build still wins vs AP even despite having 120 more at ~4 items worth of AP at all stages.

This is by no means law for every game, a 50 MR target is most effectively taken care of with 2 flat items and a bunch of AP. I was just putting them against each other with out crossing. It would get way to complicated.

I’ve seen it but no, I was never taught like that. It’s largely unfair to make this comparison too since:

Spanish tenses are much more distinguishable from each other than English tenses are 

Spanish places a huge emphasis on subjective tenses, English does not. And English subjunctive is largely used for hypothetical situations and some fringe cases whereas Spanish uses it to express doubt/uncertainty in all tenses, emotion, hypothetical situations, formal and informal commands (both affirmative and negative), etc. 

So if you added this in and consider English imperfect is used with “used to + infinitive” and conditional uses would/would not + infinitive, you’d have roughly the same amount of conjugations. Also, as we both know, the verbs if hacer and to do/to make have thousands of meanings in their languages respectively.
